item.title: jekyll serve Permission Error on Mac OS Monterey
item.description:
Jekyll serve Permission Error on Mac OS Monterey

Facing with many errors while setting up a Jekyll github page, Iâ€™m logging it for the people like me.

The problom was, I wanted to run the local server with the instruction

bundle exec jekyll serve

but the terminal showed me Permission errors.

Some said I should change the system preference to give iTerm the full disk access but I donâ€™t think it was the reason.

Thanks to Vidyut, I solved the error and the helpful link is https://luther.io/macos/how-to-install-latest-ruby-on-a-mac/

To do list

  • Delete previous Gemfile.lock
  • Install Command Line Tools for Xcode
  • Install Homebrew.
  • Install rbenv and helpers.
  • Modify your shell startup script.
  • Install Ruby.
  • Install Bundle
  • Bundle add webrick

For me, it was the problem I didnâ€™t install â€˜Command Line Tools for Xcodeâ€™.

Also, you need to remove the Gemfile.lock in your github page directory before you install bundle.

I followed his track and reinstalled homebrew, ruby, and jekyll.

And after â€˜bundle exec jekyll serveâ€™,

 ~/H/hailey99.github.io  on master !4  bundle exec jekyll serve
Configuration file: /Users/blah/blah/hailey99.github.io/_config.yml
            Source: /Users/blah/blah/hailey99.github.io
       Destination: /Users/blah/blah/hailey99.github.io/_site
 Incremental build: disabled. Enable with --incremental
      Generating... 
                    done in 2.645 seconds.
 Auto-regeneration: enabled for '/Users/blah/blah/hailey99.github.io'
                    ------------------------------------------------
      Jekyll 4.2.1   Please append `--trace` to the `serve` command 
                     for any additional information or backtrace. 
                    ------------------------------------------------
/Users/blah/.gem/ruby/3.1.0/gems/jekyll-4.2.1/lib/jekyll/commands/serve/servlet.rb:3:in `require': cannot load such file -- webrick (LoadError)

Another error ğŸ˜‚
Itâ€™s just because webrick got out of the default gem lists.

All you need to do is type

bundle add webrick

then the terminal will install webrick.

And it works!

item.title: Built my own Github page
item.description:
Iâ€™ve FINALLY got my own Github page!

Today is May 1st 2019, the day Iâ€™m flying out to Seoul. Itâ€™s been a year since I left there on April 27th, 2018! One of my goal this May is creating my own Github page, learning how to use git, being familiar with HTML, CSS, and markdown. So, Iâ€™m posting this blog at Toronto Pearson Airport that always brings up the memory of the first day in Canada.


I just wanna share some songs that I canâ€™t love more and the feelings I go through whenever I listen to the tracks.


One is Lee Sora - Track 9. This comforting song is what I listened to at the plane to Toronto. I embedded the youtube video playing with a river view of Seoul I canâ€™t wait to see it.



w

Another song is Safeplanet - à¸„à¸³à¸•à¸­à¸š, the song Iâ€™m gonna listen to in the air heading to Seoul. Iâ€™ve known this band only for 3 weeks, but Iâ€™m sure Iâ€™ll stan them for a long time cuz this band let me know the coolness of Thai indie band. Itâ€™s a shame I canâ€™t understand Thai tho.

Anyway, I hope you all have the greatest Summer and like my new Github page and these bops.

See you in Korea!
